memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP *scip, SCIP_SEPA *sepa, SCIP_SOL *sol, SCIP_Real *varsolvals, int maxtestdelta, SCIP_Real *rowweights, SCIP_Real boundswitch, SCIP_Bool usevbds, SCIP_Bool allowlocal, SCIP_Bool fixintegralrhs, int maxmksetcoefs, SCIP_Real maxweightrange, SCIP_Real minfrac, SCIP_Real maxfrac, SCIP_Bool trynegscaling, SCIP_Bool cutremovable, const char *cutclassname, SCIP_Bool *cutoff, int *ncuts, SCIP_Real *delta, SCIP_Bool *deltavalid)
memberdef.name: SCIPcutGenerationHeuristicCmir

briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure
separator
the solution that should be separated, or NULL for LP solution
LP solution value of all variables in LP
maximal number of different deltas to try (-1: unlimited)
weight of rows in aggregated row
fraction of domain up to which lower bound is used in transformation
should variable bounds be used in bound transformation?
should local information allowed to be used, resulting in a local cut?
should complementation tried to be adjusted such that rhs gets fractional?
maximal number of nonzeros allowed in aggregated base inequality
maximal valid range max(|weights|)/min(|weights|) of row weights
minimal fractionality of rhs to produce MIR cut for
maximal fractionality of rhs to produce MIR cut for
should negative values also be tested in scaling?
should the cut be removed from the LP due to aging or cleanup?
name of cut class to use for row names
whether a cutoff has been detected
pointer to count the number of generated cuts
pointer to store best delta found; NULL, if cut should be added here
pointer to store whether best delta value is valid or NULL

detaileddescription.para: Performs the cut generation heuristic of the c-MIR separation algorithm, i.e., tries to generate a c-MIR cut which is valid for the mixed knapsack set corresponding to the current aggregated constraint. Cuts will only be added here if no pointer to store best scaling factor delta is given.

briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure

detaileddescription.para: creates the cmir separator and includes it in SCIP

briefdescription.para: complemented mixed integer rounding cuts separator (Marchand's version)
